resources.string:
This app is a playground for Augmented Reality functionality around ARCore from Google. Currently mainly based around the image marker functionality.


It allows to capture marker images, crop them and try them out on the spot, to make sure the captures images are actually usable for the ARCore recognition engine.


Next step is to provide simple authoring functionality to define areaIds on the marker image and place interactive elements to sketch out some scene ideas, that can then be implemented for a specific application.


When required functionality is available, the functionality of this app will be provided as a browser app.
The application needs your approval to access the following features of your device.

Augmented reality (AR) functionality is provided using ARCore from Google, which can be installed for free from Play store. It allows to place 3D objects into the real world, giving the impression as if they\'re really there.
Unfortunately, your phone isn\'t able to run ArCore. AR scenes will be partially available as 3D models.
The camera requirement is needed for the ARCore preview. Image processing is handled locally, no images are sent back over the network
Images and settings are stored in files on the public local storage of the device in a folder called \'TouristAR\'. Other locations on the device aren\'t accessed
